Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): tighten up path types in ngstc and ngcc
Issues.Body:
Previously, we introduced the "branded" path types, `AbsoluteFsPath` and
`PathSegment` to distinguish between different kinds of path strings used
in the system. It was not possible to implicitly cast from `string` to
these types or from one type to another. The helps to prevent mistakenly
using the wrong type of path string in the wrong place.

This commit goes one step further. It locks down these types so it is not
possible to cast to a `string` either. Now one must use the `.toString()`
method on the branded path to get an actual string type. The branded paths
are still `string` values at runtime and they extend the `String` interface
so that all the string methods, (e.g. `.startsWith()`) can be used directly.

Further it was found that there were places were a string was being used
as a kind of path to represent the import specifier of a module. Such paths
can be absolute or relative but it is still helpful to reason about these
types separately to `string`, `AbsoluteFsPath` and `PathSegment`.

A new type `ModuleSpecifier` has been defined that represents this new
branded path. It has a create helper (`ModuleSpecifier.from()`) but can
be cast implicitly to `AbsoluteFsPath` and `PathSegment` as needed.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): align component template assertions with ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
This is something I ran into a few times while porting tests to `TestBed`. ViewEngine has some assertions against the metadata of a component that verifies things like that it has a template and that it can't have both `template` and `templateUrl`.

* For AoT I've aligned the error messages so they match the ones in ViewEngine and I've added unit tests for them.
* For JIT mode I've only added the error that throws if a component doesn't have a template. I didn't port most of the other errors (checking that `template` is a string, checking that `preserveWhitespaces` is a boolean etc.), because they'll be caught by TS. I also didn't do the error that ensures that both `template` and `templateUrl` aren't defined, because the way the resource resolution works is that it starts loading the `templateUrl` and then sets the result on the `template`, which means that it'll always result in an error. We could throw the error earlier (e.g. in `defineComponent`), but that would be inconsistent with ViewEngine and it wouldn't allow for `TestBed` to assign the template at a later point.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): align component template assertions with ViewEngine" (#30553)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): Move instructions back to …µ…µ
Issues.Body:
There is an encoding issue with using delta `Œî`, where the browser will attempt to detect the file encoding if the character set is not explicitly declared on a `<script/>` tag, and Chrome will find the `Œî` character and decide it is window-1252 encoding, which misinterprets the `Œî` character to be some other character that is not a valid JS identifier character

So back to the frog eyes we go.

```
    __
   /…µ…µ\
  ( -- ) - I am ineffable. I am forever.
 _/    \_
/  \  /  \
==  ==  ==
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): Move instructions back to …µ…µ" (#30546)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): evaluate map-based styling bindings with a new algorithm
Issues.Body:
This is the first refactor PR designed to change how styling bindings
(i.e. `[style]` and `[class]`) behave in Ivy. In addition to the changes
added in f03475cac8bbc79aaf13caf94b099b0c234028bc, this patch adds
functionality for map-based styling bindings such as `[style.prop]`
and `[class.name]` in ivy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): evaluate map-based styling bindings with a new algorithm" (#30543)

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): in `ngDevMode` use named object literals and arrays for easier debugging/profiling
Issues.Body:
Ivy uses object literals for speed and size. These are very hard to debugging because all types are an array or object literals without any useful hints to the developer. Similarly when profiling memory consumption it is hard to tell which object is which and so it is hard to track down memory pressure. This change enables constructor names for the Ivy dat structures making the code base more approachable.  

Here is an example what the data structure look like now in debugger:
![Screen Shot 2019-05-17 at 9 46 19 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111951/57943710-94929d80-7889-11e9-9a32-1dd9bcf4248e.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " feat(ivy): in `ngDevMode` use named object literals and arrays for easier debugging/profiling" (#30542)

Issues.Title: Context for projected template not working (but present)
Issues.Body:
So I have a component template like this: ```html
``` In the `component.ts` I have: `@ContentChild('row') rowUserTemplate: TemplateRef;` Where I use this component: ``` This is great {{ test }} ``` This gets the *projected* template, and correctly renders it, but it does not render `test`. I looked in the browser console, and I can see in the `projectedView` of the `TemplateRef` (the ContentChild), that the context does exist. Why isn't it doing the interpolation?

### Description

When following the guide on creating decleration file for imported JS-library you refer to TypeScript documentation. But no information on how to actually import a index.d.ts module file.

**Files**:

Js-file
```
function doSomething(params) {
    console.log("doesSomething ", params)
    }
```
index.d.ts file
```
declare module "functionsModule"{
    export function doSomething(param: string);
}
```
Component importing the declared module
```
import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core';
import {doSomething} from 'functionsModule';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-ownjsfile',
  templateUrl: './ownjsfile.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./ownjsfile.component.scss']
})
export class OwnjsfileComponent implements OnInit {
  constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
    doSomething("Hello World?");
  }
}

```

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): downlevel constructor parameter type information
Issues.Body:
The TypeScript `emitDecoratorMetadata` option does not support forward references of ES2015 classes due to the TypeScript compiler transforming the metadata into a direct reference of the yet to be defined class.  This results in a runtime TDZ error.  This is a known limitation of the `emitDecoratorMetadata` option.
The change in the PR removes the need for the option by storing the information in a static property function via the use of the tsickle `ctorParameters` transformation.  By leveraging the existing functionality, no changes to the framework code is necessary.  Also, minimal new code is required within the CLI, as the relevant tsickle code can be extracted and used with several local modifications.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): downlevel constructor parameter type information" (#14473)

Issues.Title: Default to production builds
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
I know this is tough due to it being a breaking change with the ecosystem, but I think `ng build` should do a production build by default.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```

```

### Description
Most of the time, developers should be building for production, and serving for development. It would save a lot of time overall if `ng build` defaulted to production mode.


### Describe the solution you'd like
During the update process to 9 (or some other version), prompt the user if they want to keep the current behavior or migrate to the new behavior, and then default all new projects with `ng new` to production by default.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
None

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| core-js | dependencies | minor | [`3.0.1` -> `3.1.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/core-js/3.0.1/3.1.0) | [source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>zloirock/core-js</summary>

### [`v3.1.0`](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​310---20190520)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.0.1...v3.1.0)

-   `String#matchAll` moved to stable ES, exposed `Symbol.matchAll`, [#​516](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/516)
-   `Promise.allSettled` moved to stage 3, [#​515](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/515)

-   Removed `es.regexp.flags` dependency from `es.regexp.to-string`, [#​536](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/536), [#​537](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/537)
-   Fixed IE8- non-enumerable properties support in `Object.{ assign, entries, values }`, [#​541](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/541)

-   Temporarily removed `core-js` dependency from `core-js-compat` since it's required for missed at this moment feature

Update `angular.json` `projects` object when generating a new library component; minimally, include a flag to control it.


### Command (mark with an `x`)

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
I wrote an [SO Question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56210978/why-angular-cli7-3-9-does-not-update-angular-json-with-new-test-target-when-cre) describing this.

The expected behavior when creating a new component using `angular-cli` is that `angular.json.projects` is updated with an entry describing the newly created component. The observed behavior is that `angular-cli` does not do so.

I found this out after running `ng test newComponent` and receiving the message `Project 'inline' does not support the 'test' target.`

The `ng test newComponent` worked after I updated `angular.json.projects` to describe the newly created component.

I updated `angular.json` manually.

Issues.Title: Provide `outputHashing` option hashing only chunk and script
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 

I have some raw html files for OGP(Open Graph Protocol), not generating by angular.
these raw html files include css file extracted by Angular-CLI such as  `<link href="/static/styles.css" rel="stylesheet" />` to match the look and style generated by Angular.
to share hashed css file generated by `ng build --prod`, I must manually modify link tag in raw html files...

now `outputHashing` has 4 options.
so, I need 5th option hashing only chunk and script.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->

for example, option`scripts` having only chunk and script hash.

```javascript
const hashFormats: { [option: string]: HashFormat } = {
    none:    { chunk: '',                       extract: '',                         file: ''                 , script: '' },
    media:   { chunk: '',                       extract: '',                         file: `.[hash:${length}]`, script: ''  },
    bundles: { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: `.[contenthash:${length}]`, file: ''                 , script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
    all:     { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: `.[contenthash:${length}]`, file: `.[hash:${length}]`, script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
    scripts: { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: '',                         file: ''                 , script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
  };
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
quit preset option. can arbitrarily indicate by key map object.

in angular.json
```json
"outputHashing": {"chunk": true, "extract": false, "file": false, "script": true}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide `outputHashing` option hashing only chunk and script" (#14463)

Issues.Title: a path configured in tsconfig.json dosen't work in ./server.ts in Angular universal mode
Issues.Body:
I have created an Agular library and puts its path to paths array in tsconfig.json
note that this path refers to 'src' of the library, not 'dist' folder


tsconfig.json:
```
    "paths": {
      "*": ["node_modules/*", "src/types/*"],
      "myLib": ["projects/myLib/src/public-api"],
      "myLib/*": ["projects/myLib/src/lib/*"]
    }
```

server.ts
```
import { example } from "myLib" //cannot resolve myLib, although when I click in this module in my IDE it directly open the correct path i.e public-api.ts file
import { example } from "projects/myLib/src/public-api" //works!
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "a path configured in tsconfig.json dosen't work in ./server.ts in Angular universal mode" (#14456)

Issues.Title: build: update webpack-dev-server to version 3.4.1
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| webpack-dev-server | dependencies | minor | [`3.3.1` -> `3.4.1`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/webpack-dev-server/3.3.1/3.4.1) | [source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack-dev-server</summary>

### [`v3.4.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​341httpsgithubcomwebpackwebpack-dev-servercomparev340v341-2019-05-17)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/compare/v3.4.0...v3.4.1)

### [`v3.4.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​340httpsgithubcomwebpackwebpack-dev-servercomparev331v340-2019-05-17)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/compare/v3.3.1...v3.4.0)

##### Bug Fixes

-   don't use self.location.port ([#​1838](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1838)) ([6d31984](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/6d31984))
-   do not include config files in dist ([#​1883](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1883)) ([c535bb2](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/c535bb2))
-   only add client entry to web targets ([#​1775](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1775)) ([cf4d0d0](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/cf4d0d0))
-   update clientLogLevel to match docs and error ([#​1825](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1825)) ([7f52bbf](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/7f52bbf))
-   add errors-warnings preset ([#​1895](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1895)) ([2a81ad2](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/2a81ad2))

##### Features

-   added injectClient option ([#​1775](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1775)) ([cf4d0d0](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/cf4d0d0))
-   added injectHot option ([#​1775](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1775)) ([cf4d0d0](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/cf4d0d0))
-   added sockPort option ([#​1792](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1792)) ([58d1682](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/58d1682))
-   added sockHost option ([#​1858](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1858)) ([f47dff2](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/f47dff2))
-   support HEAD method ([#​1875](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1875)) ([c2360e4](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/c2360e4))
-   added liveReload option ([#​1889](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/1889)) ([fc4fe32](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/commit/fc4fe32))
-   update express to 4.17 version

</details>

---

### Renovate configuration

:date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana.

:vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.

:recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "`rebase!`".

Issues.Title: @angular/cli upgrade breaks karma/jasmine sourcemap reporting
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes. Sourcemaps in karma/jasmine worked fine up to and including@angular/cli 8.0.0.beta.9, but from beta.10 to current (rc.4 today) sourcemaps no longer work. ### Description Example working output from beta.9: ``` Expected true to be falsy. at UserContext. (src/app/app.component.spec.ts:32:18) ``` Example broken output from beta.10+: ``` Error: Expected true to be falsy. at at UserContext. (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/main.js:304:22) at ZoneDelegate.invoke (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/polyfills.js:3325:26) at ProxyZoneSpec.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js.ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (http://localhos... ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * Follow https://angular.io/guide/quickstart and create a new app. * `ng test` and ensure test passes. * add to app.component.spec.ts: ``` it('should fail', () => { expect(true).toBeFalsy(); }); ``` * run `ng test` again and note you get a line number such as ` at UserContext. (src/app/app.component.spec.ts:32:18)` * `ng update --next --all --force` to update to something more recent than 8.0.0.beta.10 * repeat `ng test` and note line numbers no longer help you find your spec in app.component.ts. Instead you see something like this: ``` Error: Expected true to be falsy. at at UserContext. (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/main.js:304:22) at ZoneDelegate.invoke (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/polyfills.js:3325:26) at ProxyZoneSpec.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js.ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (http://localhos... ``` ## üî• Exception or Error n/a ## üåç Your Environment ng version:

Issues.Title: fix(popover-edit): rework host listeners to account for changes in Ivy
Issues.Body: Switches all of the inherited event listeners in `popover-edit` to use `@HostListener`. In Ivy the `host` objects are merged when inheriting, whereas in ViewEngine they are overwritten. This means that with the current setup we'll end up with double event listeners once Ivy lands.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(popover-edit): rework host listeners to account for changes in Ivy" (#16060)

Closes #15915

Issues.Title: fix(popover-edit): incorrectly caching values for more than one control
Issues.Body: Currently the edit popover uses the first `valueChange` event to know when to cache the value of its form so that it can revert to it if the user presess the `revert` button. This breaks down if the form has more than one control, because it'll emit a `valueChange` for each control that gets added. These changes fix the issue by using `NgZone` to wait for the form to be initialized.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(popover-edit): incorrectly caching values for more than one control" (#16057)

Issues.Title: feat(tabs): support pagination in nav bar
Issues.Body:
Adds support for pagination to `mat-tab-nav-bar` by moving some code around so that it can be reused from the `mat-tab-group`.

Fixes #2177.

**Some outstanding questions:**
* How should we deal with the `tabindex` in `mat-tab-nav-bar`? Currently all enabled links have `tabindex="0"`, but now that we support keyboard navigation, we could switch to the same approach as `mat-tab-group`.
* With these changes the tab header styles are imported in the Sass of both `mat-tab-nav-bar` and `mat-tab-header`. This means that these styles will be included twice and I don't think there's a nice way around it. We can include the same file through `styleUrls`, however our style inlining won't de-duplicate the styles in that case either.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(tabs): support pagination in nav bar" (#16055)

Issues.Title: [Datepicker] - Prevent autocomplete functionality
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Add the option to prevent Datepicker from auto filling a date.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Currently Datepicker does not autocomplete a date when 'Moment' considers the current input value as an invalid date. Since I need to change the business rule for the autocomplete feature (client requirement for years specifically), it would be great if I can stop the autofill in any case (not only when date is invalid) and create my own logic in a kind of middleware and send manually the new value I want to display.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Current version:
    "@angular/material": "^7.3.4",
    "@angular/material-moment-adapter": "7.3.4",
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Datepicker] - Prevent autocomplete functionality" (#16048)

Issues.Title: Docs site footer should link to full license
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The applicable license shall match on all references to a specific piece of software.

#### What is the current behavior?

Code licensed under an MIT-style License.

While the github repo has the full licence text by default, there is no link to the full licence text on the website. Stating that it is licenced under an MIT-**style** licence will create confusion about any potential change that could have been made to the agreement.

Issues.Title: build: remove example-module from gitignore
Issues.Body:
In order to work around an Angular Bazel bug where genfiles aren't
properly picked up in the `ng_module` metadata bundler, we need to
check-in the example module into the source-file and use the
example-module as a real source instead of generating it dynamically
through a genfile. This allows us to temporarily fix the examples package
until the bug (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30259) is fixed.

Issues.Title: MatMenu drop-down fails when ivy is enabled.
Issues.Body:
This issue is similar to a recently closed issue https://github.com/angular/components/issues/15937, but with a different error.

#### What is the expected behavior?
No error

#### What is the current behavior?
Drop down fails when ivy is enabled with the following errors:
First click of the button:
```
core.js:7199 ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'createEmbeddedView' of undefined
    at ViewContainerRef_.createEmbeddedView (core.js:20126)

    at MatMenuTrigger_click_HostBindingHandler (menu.js:1565)
    at executeListenerWithErrorHandling (core.js:16065)

```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. `ng new myApp --enable-ivy`
2. `cd myApp`
3. `ng add @angular/material@next`
4. Import `MatMenuModule` in `app.module.ts`
5. Add the following to `app.component.html`
```

</mat-menu>
```

I am using the latest release candidates of angular 8.  `ng version` yields the following:
```

webpack                           4.30.0
```
Browsers:
* Chrome: 73.0.3683.103 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Edge: 44.17763.1.0
* Firefox 66.0.5 (64-bit)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
* It appears that the the portal for the menu isn't properly initialized (`menu.js:1175`).
* Everything functions without error when not opting into using ivy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatMenu drop-down fails when ivy is enabled." (#16041)

Issues.Title: Add a mat-menu-group so that we can open (new) and close (old) menus on a single click.
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Similar has been asked [HERE](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48467009/how-to-open-mat-menu-on-a-single-click-and-close-other-opened-menu-if-there-is-a):

For the same reason we have `mat-accordion` wrapping `expansion-panel` we need `mat-menu-group` wrapping `mat-menu-trigger`.

Currently we have to click 2 times when a menu is already open and we want to open  a new one. This feels unnatural to me.

A wrapping instance could control the closing and opening of its menu children.

1. [JQUERY EXAMPLE](http://jsfiddle.net/jvmnrg2x/) (desired behaviour)
2. [CURRENT MAT-MENU](https://stackblitz.com/angular/dkreoalaala?file=app%2Fmenu-position-example.ts) (no fluid skimming possible.)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Definitely this would provide a better and more fluid UX if we can skim through the menus inside of a `mat-menu-group`. I like the idea of the backdrop that should still be there OUTSIDE of the `mat-menu-group`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add a mat-menu-group so that we can open (new) and close (old) menus on a single click." (#16036)

Issues.Title: Add a way to better identify clicked elements
Issues.Body: #### Please describe the feature you would like to request. Add a way to identify the element that has been clicked #### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal? Currently we are using Sentry for error reporting. In the breadcrumbs this is what we see: `div.mat-form-field-wrapper > div.mat-form-field-flex` This does not really provide us with any good info about what element was clicked. Perhaps we also could have some more into about the element's context?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a way to better identify clicked elements" (#16031)

Issues.Title: drag and drop bug with layout gap
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report

#### What is the expected behavior?
That the layout applies correctly, as it does when there is not a cdkDragPlaceHolder in it.

#### What is the current behavior?
When you drag an element sometimes the layout is not applied correctly, the elements are not in the expected way. Some of them, usually the drag placeholder, are in a wrong position.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

https://stackblitz.com/github/santiagoilli/angular-flex-layout-gap-drag-drop-issue

Take some of the right drag elements, and drag those into the left container. When you have moved a few, add one more and move it in the slot left container, you will now see how one o two of them are not in the expected position, probably the dragPlaceHolder is one of them (the one with opacity).

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I need to make a puzzle effect, so the layoutGap would be very usefull.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
"@angular/core": "~7.2.15"
"@angular/cdk": "^7.3.7"
"@angular/flex-layout": "^7.0.0-beta.24"
 "@angular/material": "^7.3.7"
"typescript": "~3.2.2"
Google Chrome Versi√≥n 74.0.3729.131 (Build oficial) (64 bits)
Windows 10 Pro 64 bits

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Sometimes the behaviour is as expected, so try to move a few of the elements and then take one from the right and move around the left container.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "drag and drop bug with layout gap" (#16033)
